. Reuters reports: " Egyptian police shot dead 17 people trying to attack two police stations on Saturday in Ben Cardini Suef governorate, south of Cairo, witnesses and medical sources said. " reports: Would-be looters broke into Cairo's famed Egyptian Museum, ripping the heads off two mummies and damaging about 10 small artifacts before being caught and detained by soldiers, Egypt's antiquities chief said Saturday. Zahi Hawass said the vandals did not manage to steal any of the museum's antiquities, and that the prized collection was now safe and under military guard. According to Ken Auletta 's sources, Eric Schmidt 's appetite for the job waned not because of the China decision, but because Google was struggling to deal with the success of Facebook and increased scrutiny from regulators. Google was becoming defensive. All of their social-network efforts had faltered. Facebook had replaced them as the hot tech company, the place vital engineers wanted to work, Ken Auletta writes.`` Complaints about Google bureaucracy intensified. Governments around the world were lobbing grenades at Google over privacy, copyright, and size issues. The` don't be evil' brand was getting tarnished,

He said the electorate was expecting that focus when Barack Obama assumed office. I think he's working very hard on the issue of unemployment, which I think is the major problem facing American right now, and I think, and I hope, this will be the centerpiece of the State of the Union speech, Colin Powell told CNN Chief Political Correspondent Candy Crowley .`` We didn't elect` Superman,' we elected a human being.''
